Additional Information

How to Apply - Help

Get more information and instructions on how to apply for a job.

Subscribe to Job Alerts

Would you like to receive alerts when jobs become available? When you complete a Job Interest Card, you will be notified when jobs that match your selected interests become available. Complete a Job Interest Card today.

Job Descriptions

The Job Description Center offers information on all official job types within the City of San Antonio, including pay ranges. These jobs do not comprise the current job openings; see Current Job Opportunities for current openings with the City of San Antonio;

see Internal Job Opportunities for employees currently with the City of San Antonio.

Sign-in to Check Application Status

The City of San Antonio uses NeoGov (Government Jobs) to display job opportunities and store application profiles and resumes. Once you have applied for a job with the City of San Antonio, you can check the status of your application or change your profile.

Animal care serVICES fellowship

The City of San Antonio is looking for emerging animal care professionals interested in a career in animal science to join the Animal Care Services (ACS) Fellowship. This year-long program offers you the opportunity to explore the operations of a modern, high-performing animal care shelter--all while earning a competitive, full-time salary and benefits. As an Animal Care Fellow, you will rotate through three (3) divisions within the department.

Veterinary Clinic: Develop your skills in animal science and husbandry while working alongside veterinarians and support staff in one of the busiest animal clinics in the country. You will get hands-on experience in administering and operating a veterinary clinic, including shelter medicine, high-volume surgeries, supply management, and client services.

Live Release: Working closely with live release staff, you will gain experience in marketing shelter animals and facilitating adoptions. You will also work with department foster volunteers and help the City manage important partner relationships critical in ensuring a forever home for every animal.

Shelter Management: Are you ready to get your hands dirty and make a difference? While supporting shelter staff, you will be able to provide direct care for shelter animals, help manage the kennel inventory, ensure accurate record keeping and legal compliance, and provide healthy, humane treatment for every animal.

This is the perfect position for anyone looking to develop the business sense and compassionate heart needed to succeed in the animal care industry.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in animal science, equine science, biology, or a related field

At least one (1) year of experience in animal husbandry is strongly preferred

TO APPLY

To apply for the ACS Fellowship Program, click here.

City Council Opportunities

At times, our City Council offices have vacancies for qualified individuals. If you are interested in serving our City Council and supporting City Council members' efforts in their respective districts, please review the opportunities listed below.

current vacancies

There are no vacancies at this time.

Potential job OPPORTUNITIEs

Chief of Staff

Communications Director

Constituent Services Director

Constituent Services Representative I

Constituent Services Representative II

Event Services Director

Policy Director

Special Assistant to Council

Zoning/Planning Director

Council Student Intern I

Council Student Intern II

Council Student Intern III

application instructions

Interested applicants may submit their resume and application online here.

Available opportunities may be hired by the City of San Antonio Council Aides Corporation. Individuals hired into these positions are not City of San Antonio employees but are employees of the Corporation. These positions answer only to the Corporation Board by whom they are employed and represent only the respective Mayor or Councilmember’s point of view in serving constituents. The Board has the exclusive right to alter the job descriptions at any time without notice.

City Council District 3 - Director of Communications

Interested individuals should send a letter of interest, resume, and professional writing sample to ana.bradshaw@sanantonio.gov.

Executive OPPORTUNITIES

The City of San Antonio’s Executive Team is comprised of the City Manager and his staff, as well as department directors and assistant directors who oversee operations of nearly 40 departments.

If you are interested in being considered for an executive position, please review the opportunities below.

Available Opportunities

City Auditor - Office of the City Auditor

Chief of Innovation (Assistant Director) - Pre-K 4 SA

To Apply

If you would like to be considered for any current or future opportunities, please email our Executive Recruiter.

Management Fellows program

Since 2007, the City of San Antonio, Texas has offered emerging local government professionals with the opportunity to immerse themselves in local government management and develop real world skills and experience as part of the Management Fellow Program. This nationally-recognized 12-month program, will give you the opportunity to complete important projects and work alongside key leaders of the nation's 7th largest city. Each Management Fellow will receive the opportunity to spend four months in each of the following departments:

the City Manager's Office

the Office of Management and Budget

one operating department

Management Fellows will be exposed to multiple challenges that local governments face today, as well as new and innovative methods to deal with these challenges.

Each rotation will provide the Management Fellows with a broad base of experience that will benefit both the individual employee as well as the City in the future.

Upon completion of the 12-month program, City staff will work with each Management Fellow to help them find a full-time position that matches their individual career interests.

The Management Fellow Program application is currently closed. The application for our 2025 cohort is expected to open in October 2025.

Learn More

San Antonio Fire Department Careers

The San Antonio Fire Department (SAFD) offers qualified individuals an opportunity to become a member of a highly skilled professional organization.

SAFD is committed to developing a highly qualified, motivated and diverse workforce that reflects the demographics of our community.

Learn more about SAFD.

San Antonio Police Department Careers

Law Enforcement Officer

The San Antonio Police Department (SAPD) takes applications year-round, and we are constantly looking for motivated and talented people to join our team. Please contact our recruiters with any questions or issues.

Find out how to join SAPD.

Civilian Employment

The San Antonio Police Department has periodic openings in civilian (non-enforcement, non-sworn) positions, such as dispatchers, school crossing guards, data entry clerks, police service agents, administrative aides, crime analysts, management analysts, evidence technicians, etc.

Apply for these civilian positions through Job Openings.

Airport Police and park police officers

$2,500 hiring incentive upon completion of academy

The City of San Antonio is currently accepting applications for individuals to serve as Park Police Officers. In addition to competitive pay and a robust total compensation package, individuals will receive a $2,500 hiring incentive upon successful completion of the academy.

Apply Here - Airport Police Officer | Position Closes: September 6

Apply Here - Park Police Officer | Position Closes: July 29
